sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Aurelia. The paragon of pleasure and princely delights contayning the seuen dayes solace (in Christmas holy-dayes) of Madona Aurelia, Queene of the Christmas pastimes, & sundry other well-courted gentlemen, and gentlewomen, in a noble gentlemans pallace. A worke most sweetely intercoursed (in ciuill and friendly disputations) with many amorous and pleasant discourses, to delight the reader: and plentifully garnished with morall notes, to make it profitable to the regarder. By G.W. Gent. Heptameron of civill discourses Whetstone, George, 1544?-1587?
[168] p.
Printed by [Thomas Orwin for] Richard Iohnes, At London : 1593.
G.W. = George Whetstone. Actual printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-X⁴. Running title reads: The Christmas pleasures of Queene Aurelia. Originally published in 1582 as: An heptameron of civill discourses. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

The paragon of pleasure and princely delights contayning the seuen dayes solace (in Christmas holy-dayes) of Madona Aurelia, Queene of the Christmas pastimes, & sundry other well-courted gentlemen, and gentlewomen, in a noble gentlemans pallace. A worke most sweetely intercoursed (in ciuill and friendly disputations) with many amorous and pleasant discourses, to delight the reader: and plentifully garnished with morall notes, to make it profitable to the regarder. By G.W. Gent. Heptameron of civill discourses Whetstone, George, 1544?-1587?
[168] p.
Printed by [Thomas Orwin for] Richard Iohnes, At London : 1593.
G.W. = George Whetstone. Actual printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-X⁴. Running title reads: The Christmas pleasures of Queene Aurelia. Originally published in 1582 as: An heptameron of civill discourses. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

[Thomas Orwin
